title: Fires In Brazil's Amazon Rainforest In August Highest Since 2010
content: The number of fires in Brazil's Amazon rainforest region for the month of August surged to the highest level since 2010, government data showed on Sunday, after a record drought that has been plaguing the biome.
summary: The number of fires in Brazil's Amazon rainforest region for the month of August surged to the highest level since 2010, government data showed on Sunday, after a record drought that has been plaguing the biome.

title: Helicopter Of Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi Crashed Due To Weather: Probe
content: Iran's final investigation into the May helicopter crash that killed president Ebrahim Raisi has found it was caused by bad weather, the body investigating the case said Sunday.
summary: Iran's final investigation into the May helicopter crash that killed president Ebrahim Raisi has found it was caused by bad weather, the body investigating the case said Sunday.

title: Israel Main Labour Union Orders Complete Strike After Hostages Found Dead
content: The head of Israel's powerful Histadrut trade union ordered a "complete strike" in support of Gaza hostages on Monday and urged a deal to secure their release after the bodies of six captives were recovered.
summary: The head of Israel's powerful Histadrut trade union ordered a "complete strike" in support of Gaza hostages on Monday and urged a deal to secure their release after the bodies of six captives were recovered.

title: Who Will Replace Rishi Sunak To Lead The Tories? A Look At The Race Within
content: Even in the UK's most Conservative constituency, the former governing party's contest to choose a new leader is failing to set pulses racing.
summary: Even in the UK's most Conservative constituency, the former governing party's contest to choose a new leader is failing to set pulses racing.

title: Israel Recovers 6 Hostage Bodies From Gaza As West Bank Violence Rages
content: Israel announced Sunday its troops had found six dead hostages in a Gaza tunnel, as Israeli police said a "shooting attack" in the occupied West Bank killed three officers.
summary: Israel announced Sunday its troops had found six dead hostages in a Gaza tunnel, as Israeli police said a "shooting attack" in the occupied West Bank killed three officers.

title: Pak's Peshawar Emerges As 'Epicentre' Of Mpox As Tally Reaches 5: Report
content: Amid growing concerns over the new strain of mpox virus, Pakistan's Peshawar city has started emerging as the 'epicentre' of the virus, as the fifth mpox case was recorded on Sunday, Geo News reported.
summary: Amid growing concerns over the new strain of mpox virus, Pakistan's Peshawar city has started emerging as the 'epicentre' of the virus, as the fifth mpox case was recorded on Sunday, Geo News reported.

title: Brazil Top Court's "Fake" Judge Deliberately Interfered In Election: Musk
content: Calling Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes "a fake judge", tech billionaire Elon Musk on Sunday said that evidence is growing to show that he deliberately interfered in the country's election held last year.
summary: Calling Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes "a fake judge", tech billionaire Elon Musk on Sunday said that evidence is growing to show that he deliberately interfered in the country's election held last year.

title: 17 Bodies Found After Mi-8 Helicopter With 22 Onboard Crashes In Russia
content: Rescuers on Sunday said they had found 17 bodies after a helicopter crashed with 22 people aboard in Russia's Kamchatka peninsula in the far east.
summary: Rescuers on Sunday said they had found 17 bodies after a helicopter crashed with 22 people aboard in Russia's Kamchatka peninsula in the far east.

title: Israel Vows To Settle Score With Hamas As Bodies Of Hostages Found In Gaza
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed on Sunday to "settle the score" with Hamas after the military had recovered the bodies of six hostages from a Gaza tunnel.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed on Sunday to "settle the score" with Hamas after the military had recovered the bodies of six hostages from a Gaza tunnel.

title: Germany's Far-Right Poised To Win Regional Elections
content: Two east German states have begun casting votes today, with the far-right political party Alternative for Germany (AfD) poised to win a state election for the first time.
summary: Two east German states have begun casting votes today, with the far-right political party Alternative for Germany (AfD) poised to win a state election for the first time.

title: Some Israeli Hostages Found Dead "Approved" For Potential Release: Hamas
content: A senior Hamas official said Sunday that several of the six Israeli hostages found dead in a Gaza tunnel had been "approved" for release in the event of a truce deal.
summary: A senior Hamas official said Sunday that several of the six Israeli hostages found dead in a Gaza tunnel had been "approved" for release in the event of a truce deal.

title: Who Was Hersh Goldberg-Polin, US Citizen Who Was Killed By Hamas In Gaza
content: Israeli-American hostage Hersh Goldberg-Polin was announced dead early Sunday morning by Israeli authorities. The 23-year-old was kidnapped by Hamas militants during the October 7 attack on southern Israel.
summary: Israeli-American hostage Hersh Goldberg-Polin was announced dead early Sunday morning by Israeli authorities. The 23-year-old was kidnapped by Hamas militants during the October 7 attack on southern Israel.

title: Wind, Rain Make Search For Missing Russian Helicopter With 22 Aboard Difficult
content: More than 60 people were battling heavy winds and rains on Sunday searching for a Russian helicopter that went missing the day before with 22 aboard in the far eastern peninsula of Kamchatka, the emergencies ministry said.
summary: More than 60 people were battling heavy winds and rains on Sunday searching for a Russian helicopter that went missing the day before with 22 aboard in the far eastern peninsula of Kamchatka, the emergencies ministry said.

title: Photographer Captures Most Detailed Photos Of Moon Ever Taken. See Here
content: Darya Kawa Mirza's photograph, which he described as the "clearest and sharpest Moon image" he has ever captured, was the result of four days of continuous observation and shooting.Â
summary: Darya Kawa Mirza's photograph, which he described as the "clearest and sharpest Moon image" he has ever captured, was the result of four days of continuous observation and shooting.

title: Houthi Rebels Say They Attacked Merchant Ship Off Yemen
content: Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels said Saturday they had attacked a merchant ship in the Gulf of Aden, as a multinational naval force said two missiles exploded near a Liberia-flagged vessel.
summary: Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels said Saturday they had attacked a merchant ship in the Gulf of Aden, as a multinational naval force said two missiles exploded near a Liberia-flagged vessel.

title: Ukrainian Drones Target Oil Refinery, Power Plants In Moscow, Says Russia
content: Russia said Sunday that it had thwarted a "massive" Ukrainian drone attack by downing 158 drones across 15 regions, including two over the capital Moscow.
summary: Russia said Sunday that it had thwarted a "massive" Ukrainian drone attack by downing 158 drones across 15 regions, including two over the capital Moscow.

title: China Woman Fakes Miscarriages, Forges Medical Records To Claim Rs 7.8 Lakh
content: She created convincing documents, including a maternity certificate and discharge summary, falsely claiming hospitalisation for a miscarriage.
summary: She created convincing documents, including a maternity certificate and discharge summary, falsely claiming hospitalisation for a miscarriage.

title: Thousands In Australia Without Power Amid Heavy Rain
content: Tens of thousands of people in Australia's southern island state of Tasmania were without power on Sunday after a cold front brought damaging winds and heavy rains, sparking flood warnings.
summary: Tens of thousands of people in Australia's southern island state of Tasmania were without power on Sunday after a cold front brought damaging winds and heavy rains, sparking flood warnings.

title: Explained: Mexico's Judicial Reform Plan And The Controversy Around It
content: Judicial reforms championed by Mexico's outgoing president, Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, and supported by his incoming successor have sparked diplomatic tensions with the United States and upset financial markets.
summary: Judicial reforms championed by Mexico's outgoing president, Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, and supported by his incoming successor have sparked diplomatic tensions with the United States and upset financial markets.

title: Hostages "Brutally Murdered" Shortly Before We Reached Them: Israel
content: The Israeli military announced today that it had discovered the bodies of six hostages in an underground tunnel in the southern Gaza Strip.
summary: The Israeli military announced today that it had discovered the bodies of six hostages in an underground tunnel in the southern Gaza Strip.
